column4: My ubuntu 11.4 system won't conntect the network card to the router either manual settings or dhcp.
It used to, but it won't after I needed to reboot it.
I've looked in tons of docs, and the diagnostics I've found seem to suggest that card is up.
I have other Ubuntu boxes (and non-U) on network working fine. Problem is recent--box has been working for months.
In logs, DCHP timeout.  Continual log about eth0: link up--many times a minute
Any dchp troubleshooting manuals?  I haven't found them yet.  Any help appreciated...thanks!
networking won't come up. my box won't connect. diagnostics say card is OK.  Router hasn't changed
has the interface worked in ubuntu before?
yes.  Worked for months until about 2 days ago.
I suggest you reboot, then get logged in and run:  dmesg | less    and read through, some of it will relate to the network and you can diagnose
I am confused by the messages.  I see "ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): eht0: link is not ready", then a bunch of "r8169 0000:04:00.0 eth0: link down" ...
then a tremendous number of "r8169 0000:04:00.0 eth0: link up"
after one line "ADDRCONF(NETDEV_CHANGE): eth0: link becomes ready"
This seems to mean the card took longer than expected to come up, but it did, and then it did again (thousands of times).  The "link up" message continues to fill kernel and syslog

Do see something strange when the card first loads:  (unregistered net_device): unknown MAC using family default.   I think this seems OK though.  Two lines later it gives the mac address that it had been using.
anyone else reporting the same message on any forums etc?

The best lead I can find so far looks like the messages that I am getting during the actual attempt to authenticate DHCP.  NetworkManager[690]: <info> (eth0): device state change: 7 -> 9 (reason 5).  Couldn't find the list of these codes and reasons.  Any help here?
